title: Trip Tracker for Android Wear
summary: Shows you information as you drive, right on your Android™ Wear smartwatch!
developerAddress:
PO Box 71
Black Forest, SA 5035
Australia
description: Trip Tracker shows you information as you drive, right on your Android™ Wear smartwatch.**To get the most value from this app you must have a smartwatch running Android Wear**Features• Speedometer: See your current speed and heading with a quick glance at your watch• Secondary information: trip time, distance, average speed and max speed.• Option to automatically launch when you start driving (can be changed to cycling or running).• Show your recent trips on a map on your handheld device• Displays as a notification, so that you can easily use other apps at the same time (such as navigation).• Show as km/h, mph, or knots (configurable)How to StartThere are four ways you can begin tracking your trip:1. On your watch: Say "Start Trip Tracker" on the voice command screen.2. On your watch: Tap your watch-face, scroll to the bottom, tap 'Start' and tap 'Trip Tracker'3. On your phone: Use the button provided to start and stop tracking.4. With option enabled: Start driving, and your trip will automatically start being tracked.If the tracker was started automatically using the auto-start option, it will automatically stop when you get out of the car and start walking. If you started tracking manually, then tracking will continue until manually stopped.Feedback and feature suggestions are encouraged. Please don't hesitate to contact the developer if you run into any issues, or if you would like to see any particular features in future releases. We will gladly take your advice on board to make this app more useful.The accuracy of the information displayed in this app depends on the GPS accuracy of your phone, which can be limited at particular locations and times. This app will not work accurately if GPS location is unavailable or switched off (on your phone). The information displayed in this app should not be relied upon for determining compliance with speed limits or any other legal restrictions.
descriptionHTML:
Trip Tracker shows you information as you drive, right on your Android™ Wear smartwatch.

**To get the most value from this app you must have a smartwatch running Android Wear**

Features
• Speedometer: See your current speed and heading with a quick glance at your watch
• Secondary information: trip time, distance, average speed and max speed.
• Option to automatically launch when you start driving (can be changed to cycling or running).
• Show your recent trips on a map on your handheld device
• Displays as a notification, so that you can easily use other apps at the same time (such as navigation).
• Show as km/h, mph, or knots (configurable)

How to Start
There are four ways you can begin tracking your trip:
1. On your watch: Say "Start Trip Tracker" on the voice command screen.
2. On your watch: Tap your watch-face, scroll to the bottom, tap 'Start' and tap 'Trip Tracker'
3. On your phone: Use the button provided to start and stop tracking.
4. With option enabled: Start driving, and your trip will automatically start being tracked.

If the tracker was started automatically using the auto-start option, it will automatically stop when you get out of the car and start walking. If you started tracking manually, then tracking will continue until manually stopped.

Feedback and feature suggestions are encouraged. Please don't hesitate to contact the developer if you run into any issues, or if you would like to see any particular features in future releases. We will gladly take your advice on board to make this app more useful.

The accuracy of the information displayed in this app depends on the GPS accuracy of your phone, which can be limited at particular locations and times. This app will not work accurately if GPS location is unavailable or switched off (on your phone). The information displayed in this app should not be relied upon for determining compliance with speed limits or any other legal restrictions.
comments: Seems to work well, and is accurate enough for my needs. I was bummed to find out that all stats aren't saved for review after ending trip. All you're able to see after ending is a map view. Stats such as time, average speed, and maximum speed are lost as soon as you tap "end trip". If you're interested in saving those be sure to write them down someplace before you end. If saving those can be implemented somehow I would likely raise to 5 stars.

Not very useful. I can find the trip stats after the trip is finished other than the map. Also I just came home from the store and the app said I maxed out my speed at 581.9mph no wonder people were flipping me off.
Pretty good So far its accurate but I was really hoping it would give me a log of the miles I traveled.
No support option Tried playing music thru headphones the same time running trip tracker, turn off tracker, music works fine.
Why everyone have this Buy it

It does what it says I can now change my review :) this app works fantastically, it starts and stops it's self and uses a proper card notification rather than an open app. App has good support on the development side and is updated well.
recentChanges: - Trips are now recorded and can be shown on a map with the phone app.
- Trips can now be started/stopped from the phone app.
- Added sensitivity setting to allow control if trips are false-starting.
- Better handling of watch disconnecting from phone.
